abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was satisfactory, the sustainability
            was likely, the institutional development impact was
            substantial, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            satisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that It is
            essential to formulate the project development objectives
            (PDO) with maximum clarity, accuracy and realism in mind.
            Robust and credible economic analysis of environmental
            projects is important. In multi-phase programs, it is
            important to define targets the achievement of which will
            trigger the launch of the next program phase. Creation of
            overly strong implementing agencies drains qualified staff
            and lowers morale in the line ministries. To integrate
            environmental program into the mainstream development
            agenda, maximize development effectiveness and capture
            potential synergies, environmental projects should
            coordinate their focus and interventions with other
            development projects in the country. Strategically placed
            regional and local capacity for environmental management -
            in terms of trained staff and basic office support - is
            essential for efficient implementation of field-level
            project activities in target zones. For complex projects
            with a large number of multiple implementing agencies (key
            implementing agencies, local governments, NGOs, independent
            service providers) use results-based or performance-based
            contracts as a main vehicle of project implementation
            insteadof the traditional disbursement arrangements.
